conclusion: Block A of a right-angled triangle with a mass of M is placed on an inclined plane with an inclination of θ. When θ = 37°, the block can just rest on the inclined plane.
Change θ to 30°, and put a smooth cylinder B with mass m between A and the inclined plane.
We need to find the friction force of A on the slope in the second configuration.

premise: When a block is at the limiting position: Normal force: N = Mg·cos(37°), Component of gravity along the incline: Mg·sin(37°), Maximum friction force: f_max = μN = μMg·cos(37°), At equilibrium: f_max = Mg·sin(37°)
The coefficient of friction between block A and the inclined plane is μ = 0.75.
conclusion: For static equilibrium of the cylinder, the net force along the incline must be zero: N_AB·sin(30°) - mg·sin(30°) = 0

premise: For block A: Component of gravity down the incline: Mg·sin(30°), Normal force from cylinder: N_AB = mg, Friction force: f_A
conclusion: For static equilibrium of block A along the incline: f_A - Mg·sin(30°) + N_AB·sin(30°) = 0
